double HistogramFitFCN::operator() ( const std::vector< double > &  par  )  const

Definition at line 20 of file HistogramFitFCN.cpp.

References fH1, and fH2.

00020                                                                       {
00021   // Chi2 fit with pedestal P, amplitude A, and timing T
00022   // Warning: The time is truncated to an int, so if there's
00023   // so if the step size in MINUIT is smalled than 1,
00024   // Any value of T will probably be seen as minimized, which it
00025   // almost certainly will not be.
00026   double chi2 = 0.;
00027   double P = par[0];
00028   double A = par[1];
00029   int T_i = (int)par[2];            // Integral part of time shift
00030   double T_f = par[2] - (double)T_i; // Floating point offset for linear interpolation
00031   
00032 
00033   int bounds[2];
00034   bounds[0] = std::max(T_i - fH1->GetNbinsX() / 2, 1);
00035   bounds[1] = std::min(T_i + fH1->GetNbinsX() / 2 - 1, fH2->GetNbinsX());
00036 
00037   // Chi2 will be zero if shift is too high
00038   if (bounds[1] <= bounds[0])
00039     std::cout << "ERROR: Fit of two histograms involves shifting one out-of-bounds (no overlap)!" << std::endl;
00040 
00041   double f;
00042   for (int i = bounds[0]; i <= bounds[1]; ++i) {
00043     f = fH1->GetBinContent(i - T_i) + (fH1->GetBinContent(i - T_i + 1) - fH1->GetBinContent(i - T_i)) * T_f;
00044     f = A * f + P;
00045     chi2 += std::pow((fH1->GetBinContent(i) - f) / fH1->GetBinError(i), 2.);
00046   }
00047 
00048   static bool print_dbg = false;
00049   if (print_dbg) {
00050     std::cout << "Fit:\tChi2 " << chi2 << "\tP "
00051               << P << "(" << par[0] << ")\tA " << A << "(" << par[1] << ")\tT " << T_i << " " << T_f << "(" << par[2] << ")" << " " << 0.02345
00052               << std::endl;
00053     std::cout << "Bounds " << bounds[0] << "-" << bounds[1]
00054               << "\tH1NX " << fH1->GetNbinsX()
00055               << "\tH2NX " << fH2->GetNbinsX()
00056               << std::endl; 
00057   }
00058   return chi2;
00059 }
